author: brane
msg: Make the environment cache and associated odds and ends thread-safe.
Set DB_DBT_USERMEM on the result DBT's, as required by DB_THREAD.
* bdb/env.c: Includ apr_thread_mutex.h, apr_thread_proc.h and apr_time.h.
Update the docs about the environment cache.
(bdb_env_t): Use thread-private storage for the error info.
(get_error_info): New; use everywhare to access bdb_env_t.error_info.
(create_env): Allocate a thread-private storage key for error_info.
Don't close the dbconfig_file, since it has its own pool cleanup.
(bdb_cache_init): Return an svn_error_t* and make thread-safe.
(svn_fs_bdb__close): Check that bdb_baton is valid.  Call bdb_cache_init
(bdb_open): If threads are enabled, assert the DB_THREAD flag.

author: cmpilato
msg: - Python doesn't appear to have a decent built-in UUID generation
module, which means that users of the Python bindings can't
- There are a whole lotta places through the codebase that are
doing their own apr_uuid_get() + apr_uuid_format() calls.  This
allows that work to be factorized and shared.
NOTE: for some reason the Python bindings appear to require an
explicit pool argument when using this new interface.  Not sure why...
New file for miscellaneous functions (as if being in the miscellany

author: danderson
msg: Make the distribution script use the default C locale for all
packaging operations. Without this, if the release manager forgets to
set the locale in his shell before rolling tarballs, some files may
* dist.sh: set and export LC_ALL=C and LANG=C before executing any

author: brane
msg: Forbid reopening a cached environment with a different set of flags.
General cleanup, removing various 'FIXME's and introducing a more
portable use of the apr_atomic API.
* bdb/env.h: Don't include apr_atomic.h. Update docstrings.
Include apr_atomic.h here instead of in bdb/env.h.
Used to hide differences in the apr_atomic API between apr-0.x
and apr-1.x.  Use everywhere instead of apr_atomic names.
(bdb_env_t): New field 'flags'.  Change type of the 'panic' field.
(svn_fs_bdb__open): Check open flags against cached environment.
